adjectives.description: decidable (comparative more decidable, superlative most decidable)

entries.meaning: (computer science) describing a set for which there exists an algorithm that will determine whether any element is or is not within the set in a finite amount of time.
examples: It is easy to show that the set of even numbers is decidable by creating the relevant Turing machine.

entries.meaning:
(logic) in intuitionistic logic, a proposition P is decidable in a given theory if it can be proven from the theory that "either P or not P", i.e. in symbols: 
  
    
      
        P
        ∨
        ¬
        P
      
    
    {\displaystyle P\vee \neg P}
  
.
